### klexos
n. _/kleks-ohs/_ (origin, Greek) <br>
1. The art of dwelling on the past. <br>From klecksography, which is the art of making images from inkblots, famously used in Rorschach psychoanalytic tests. Interpreting their ambiguity is thought to illuminate the subconscious of the patient. <br>Source: [The Dictionary of Obscure Sorrows](https://www.thedictionaryofobscuresorrows.com/concept/klexos) 

### antiklexos
n. _/antikleksos/_ (origin, English, Greek) <br> 
1. opposite of klexos. The use of practical techniques and tools based on sound first principles to stop being fixated on the past and things you cannot change. <br>
2. turning the memories that you were fixated on into sources of inspiration for big achievements.
